content:
Here are some well-known poets who have mentioned the Canary Islands in their works:

1. John Keats - "The Eve of St. Agnes"
2. Robert Louis Stevenson - "The Canaries"
3. Percy Bysshe Shelley - "To the Canary Bird"
4. Jorge Luis Borges - "La Palma"
5. Vicente Aleixandre - "La Gomera"
6. Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer - "Rimas"
7. Fray Luis de León - "Obras Completas"
8. José Martínez Ruiz (Azorín) - "La Estrella de Seville"
9. Blas de Otero - "Antología Poética"
10. José Agustín Goytisolo - "Reivindicación del Conde don Julián"
11. Francisco de Quevedo - "Obras completas"
12. Francisco de Paula Santander - "Obras Completas"
13. Rosalía de Castro - "Cantares Gallegos"
14. Luis Cernuda - "Desolación de la Quimera"
15. Leopoldo Panero - "Poesía completa"
16. José Hierro - "Antología poética"
17. Clara Janés - "Antología poética"
18. José Manuel Caballero Bonald - "La cita y otros poemas"
19. Jaime Gil de Biedma - "Antología poética"
20. Ángela Figuera Aymerich - "La luz errante"

These poets may have mentioned the Canary Islands in various ways, such as in poems dedicated solely to the islands, or in passing as part of a larger work.
